measured_by: 7-point Likert scale question: 'Would it be morally appropriate if you invested in companies from the following industries?'
justification: Materials and methods: "We asked participants to judge the moral appropriateness of holding stocks … Participants used a 7-point Likert scale, with endpoints labelled 1 (not at all) and 7 (completely)."

measured_by: 7-point Likert scale question: 'Would you feel comfortable if your pension fund invested in companies from the following industries?'
justification: Materials and methods: "…and how comfortable they would feel if their pension fund invested in these stocks … Participants used a 7-point Likert scale, with endpoints labelled 1 (not at all) and 7 (completely)."

measured_by: two-item self-report risk tolerance scale (Dohmen et al., 2011)
justification: Materials and methods: "Participants … answered two items that assessed their subjective risk tolerance (Dohmen et al., 2011)."

measured_by: single self-report item on perceived investment knowledge
justification: Materials and methods: "Participants … answered two items that assessed their subjective risk tolerance and their subjective investment knowledge."

measured_by: six-item investment knowledge test (van Rooij et al., 2011)
justification: Materials and methods: "Additionally, participants completed a six-item investment knowledge test that was meant to assess their objective investment knowledge … (van Rooij et al., 2011)."
